topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554703df636872673ade0900#post_554703df636872673ade0900
Follow people, make tweets (140 character messages), re-tweet other people's tweets (basically reblogging posts), favorite tweets, and that's all I figured out so far

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55470495636872672d490b00#post_55470495636872672d490b00
They're the only thing "steampunk" related that I truly love.

Except that SP 4449 was built in the 1940s, and represents the Art Deco era of the United States. The era of "steampunk" as people know it ended with the decline of the Edwardian Era.

So steam locos like 4449 were..._post-steampunk_, if you could describe it as such.
